Defeat Orcs in the Welkin-lofts (5/6)

'This is the plan. When next Gorgar goes to meet with the Dragon, you and Glúrkub will steal the mithril hammer from the weapon rack when Gorgar leaves it behind. If the goblin carries out his part in the plan, I will release him. In this way he will earn his freedom, and we will deprive Gorgar of his most deadly weapon, the hammer with which he slew Stóthkell and so many others.'
Talk to Durin by the cage north of Maergrind, in Máttugard
Find the path to the summit in the south-east heights of the Welkin-lofts
Talk to Glúrkub in Máttugard

'The Orcs may call it Lugroz, but to us those high places are known as the Welkin-lofts. Climb up there, slaying any of the Orcs you encounter, and see if the path to the summit is as Glúrkub described.\n\n'If there is no such weapon-rack, we will know his story for what it is: full of lies. But if he does tell the truth, and there is such a place for Gorgar to leave the mithril hammer when he is summoned by the Dragon... well, in that case, see if there is a hiding place nearby. I may have the beginning of a plan.'

'So it is as Glúrkub said? Then we will proceed with the plan.

If the goblin carries out his part in the plan, I will release him. In this way he will earn his freedom, and we will deprive Gorgar of his most deadly weapon, the hammer with which he slew Stóthkell and so many others.

'Can you accomplish this, [placeholder]? I trust no other with this important task.'
You need to find a hiding place nearby! Perhaps one could be found in the stand of trees to the north-west.
Defeated Orcs in the Welkin-lofts ([placeholder]/6)
Orcs prowl the Welkin-lofts, and Durin has asked you to defeat those you find there.

'I already told the important dwarf I agree to the bargain. What else would I do? Think about it? No one likes a cage, goblin or dwarf. And I know, because I used to close the cages and not open them! But that's not important now, no it isn't. I have been so helpful, haven't I?\n\n'Glúrkub can command Gorgar's Orcs to leave the fancy hammer undefended. It will be easy, you will see. And then freedom for Glúrkub!'
Durin is north of Maergrind and down one level, by the cage holding Glúrkub in Máttugard.

The path to the summit can be found atop a snow-covered terrace in the south-eastern heights of the Welkin-lofts.
A weapon rack stands by the path to the summit, as Glúrkub described.
